name: Blinker
author: John Conway
description: A period 2 oscillator that is the smallest and most common oscillator.

name: Toad
author: Simon Norton
description: A period 2 oscillator. The second most common oscillator (after the blinker).

name: Pulsar
author: John Conway
description: A period 3 oscillator. Despite its size, this is the fourth most common oscillator (and byfar the most common of period greater than 2).

name: Pentadecathlon
author: John Conway
description: 10 cells placed in a row evolve into this object, which is the most natural oscillator of period greater than 3. In fact, it is the fifth or sixth most common oscillator overall, being about as frequent as the clock, but much less frequent than the blinker, toad, beacon or pulsar.

name: Glider
author: Richard K. Guy
description: The smallest, most common, and first discovered spaceship. Diagonal, has period 4 and speed c/4.

name: Lightweight spaceship
author: John Conway
description: A very well-known period 4 c/2 orthogonal spaceship.
